intro: Galega officinalis var. villosa, commonly known as hairy goat's rue, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems covered in fine, hairy pubescence. The plant produces small, yellow,蝶形花 (butterfly-shaped) flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the Fabaceae family. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with small, oval leaflets and a distinctive, glandular appearance. This plant is adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
